about.summary: A simple Python library for easily displaying tabular data in a visually appealing ASCII table format

name: prettytable
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "prettytable" %}
{% set version = "0.7.2" %}
{% set hash_type = "sha256" %}
{% set hash = "2d5460dc9db74a32bcc8f9f67de68b2c4f4d2f01fa3bd518764c69156d9cacd9" %}
{% set build = 3 %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  {{ hash_type}}: {{ hash }}

build:
  noarch: python
  number: {{ build }}
  script: python -m pip install --no-deps --ignore-installed .


requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python
    - setuptools

  run:
    - python
  run_constrained:
    - ptable >=9999

test:
  imports:
    - prettytable

about:
  home: http://code.google.com/p/prettytable
  license_file: COPYING
  license: BSD 3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  summary: 'A simple Python library for easily displaying tabular data in a visually appealing ASCII table format'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - anguslees
    - pmlandwehr
    - licode
